title: Which is grammatically correct, “I knew this just now” or “I know this just now”? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Just now”, has defined the tense as the present, and to “know” something in the moment, cannot had been known in the past. Therefore to preserve the tense and make sense, it would be “I know this just now”. More commonly we say “I just now know this…”, “I just now caught wind of this”, “I just now was informed”, “I just now became aware”, “I just now figured it out, caught on, get it” To make the past form of “know” or “knew” work we could say, Just now I realized that I already knew this. In this case we have “just” became aware that we already knew something in the past, but in the moment we achieved or obtained this awareness. …..
